oai_dc:dc.dc:title: MORPHOLOGICAL VULNERABILITY INDEX: A SIMPLE WAY TO DETERMINING BEACH BEHAVIOUR
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ferreira, Oscar
Taborda, Rui
Dias, J. Alveirinho
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: morphological vulnerability index
beach behavior
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A simple morphological based index to determine beach vulnerability is proposed in this paper. The presented morphological vulnerability index (Iy) relates maximum annual volumetric difference and average beach volume for each particular site. High index values are representative of coastlines vulnerable to After the index application to 15 Portuguese sites it was possible to determine empirical threshold values, defining limits between beach stages. Based on these limits the beaches can be classified as: robust beaches, for Iv < 0.35; fragile beaches, for 0.35 < Iy 0.9. The index validation tests against field observations and recent shoreline evolution gave good results, indicating that the Iv has a strong potential application to characterise medium to long-term beach evolution.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 26 (1998): Proceedings of 26th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1998.
